intro: Weihea elliottii, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, yellow, or white. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the tropical climate of Hawaii. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
